author: hdmoadmin
title: Ray, Bearcats Pound Paris, 41-0
text:
11:31 pm - October 15, 2015 Ray, Bearcats Pound Paris, 41-0 
He’s gone . Carson Ray scored on this play at Paris Thursday night, but it was called back due to a hold. Ray finished with 101 yards and a touchdown and also scored a touchdown on defense. 
By Glenn M. Parrish 
Democrat Editor 
Carson Ray ran for 101 yards and a touchdown and returned a fumble for a touchdown for the second straight week and third time this season to lead the Junior High Bearcats to a 41-0 win in Paris Thursday. 
The Bearcats (7-0, 5-0 Conference 3A-4) led 7-0 on the strength of Brandon Ulmer’s 81-yard opening kickoff return when Ray went 54 yards for a touchdown that was called back due to a hold and reduced to a 3 yard gain. 
After touchdown runs by Marcus Nichols and Michael Hesson, the later covering 80 yards, it was 20-0 after a quarter. 
Hesson caused a fumble that Ray returned 18 yards for a touchdown to make it 27-0 with 6:21 left in the first half. 
Scoring from 73 yards out, Ray then carried both downs of a two play, 84-yard drive and the Bearcats were up 34-0 at the half. 
Evan Schlinker took over at quarterback in the second half and his first two carries resulted in 10 yards in losses. His next carry went 37 yards for a touchdown on what would be the final play of the night. 
Seventh Grade Bearcats 20 Paris 14 
Colton Ritchie ran for two touchdowns but it was a 3-yard touchdown pass from Ty Goff to Jarrett Mitchell with 7 seconds to go that beat the Eagles, 20-14. 
Ritchie ran for 117 yards on 16 carries and Ethan Wooldridge added 60 yards on 13 carries as the Bearcats (5-2, 4-1 Conference 3A-4) bounced back a week after their first conference loss.
